doc.title: Because I Can
doc.plot: Post 9/11, dark and disturbing Because I Can touches on a number of issues, whist portraying a kafka-esque vision of a never-ending cycle of violence in which the perpetrators are as much the victims as the detainees. Set in a desolate prison cell, the action seems timeless- and the resulting anonymity of both the characters and their surrounding makes the events all the more horrific.
